content.description:
Stem and press to get established in the V Slot chimney and then stem all the way up it.

Hardest move is the first.

Start on the chockstone as for Sabres of Paradise and traverse leftwards into Sabresonic.  You do the initial crux of Sabres of Paradise and then head straight into SabresonicÂ’s crux.  A sweet power-endurance link-up!

Start with your feet on the back wall and move up the blunt double aretes to the lip and jugs. It appears that you can work your way up with either hand to the lip, I went right, using a heal hook. No more than 3 hard moves to the jugs.
content.protection: Pads, there is a rock for your leg to land on and one for your head and both hit since you are horizontal.
content.location: Just left of the wedged block starting on 2 pockets at the lip of the overhang on the blunt arete feature.

content.description:
My vote for best traverse at the Happies.  Very diverse.  Start on the chalkstone and head left, exiting at the far left of the wall before the crack/alcove.

The beginning offers steep gym-like moves, while the end sports a pumpy crux going through a scoop feature.  This is a popular after work training route for a lot of Bish locals.  Feels more 5.13- than V7.  Climbable in the summer in the evenings, though you should probably be climbing somewhere else...
content.location: West rim; Trail heads up to the rim near the Totty Boulder.

content.description: Big move off of an undercling up to the traverse holds, then a big move up to some small or sloping crimps and a pop to better holds out right and eventually up. The jug sidepull/hueco out left is off.
content.location: Climbs the scooped wall to the left of the wedged block from a sit start.

content.description: Sit start then climb directly up the steep prow.
Sit start with hands in large pockets, then using more large pockets and a flake or two move up and right.
Sit start then up and left, passing a small right facing flake, which may or maynot be used - you choose.   Continue up the short pocketed wall to finish.

Sit start at good pockets.   Pull on and up rightwards to gain a good undercling with the right hand.   Muscle passed this then move more easily up the short wall above using pockets to finish with a mantle and a good jug.

Sit start to the right of the large pockets, and move directly up the wall avoiding all the good pockets on the left or right.   The crux is moving through to the finishing jug.

A forced lined.
Sit start to the right of the slot chimney.   Follow the large set of pockets up and right to the finishing jug and mantle.

A very fun, core and footwork intensive and slightly sharp traverse on incredible tableland pockets!

Sit start on the starting block as for "Sabres of Paradise" and climb rightwards onto the pocket filled roof.

Keep traversing right on increasingly bad pockets, where you will encounter a crux section.

Once past this thin section climb up and right and make a long move to a small crimp and get established onto the slab.

Sit start with right hand in a good deep sharp pocket and left in a smaller finger pocket.

Pull on then make a tricky move to gain the gaston hold with your left, then move right to crimps.

From the crimps finish direct.
content.protection: Pads - watch the block behind you.

content.description: Sit start at the pockets under the bulge. Same start as for Sabresonic. Move up and right to more pockets and make a hard move up to a razor blade crimp on the left side of the blunt prow. From here cross or bump into better holds and topout on jugs. A short sharp problem with only 2 or 3 hard moves. Hard to grade. Fun moves but can be pretty painful.
content.location: Sabres of Paradise area. Next to stroking the walrus and sabresonic.

content.description: Sit start on the right edge of the small buttress adjacent to The Orb. Traverse from left on great pockets, finishing with a casual mantle. Quite fun!
content.location: On the small buttress just to right of the wall with "The Orb".

climbs.name: DIRT is a Four Letter Word

content.description: Located on the steep wall to the right of The Orb.  Using the left hand crack/undercling feature and a sandy right-hand sloper, slap up to the lip and then make a few moves up and left to top out.  Worth it if you are bored or have already done everything else in the area.
content.protection: a pad to protect your coccyx.
content.location: This is the wierd undercling feature on the wall just right of The Orb.

content.description:
Sit start as per

Sabres of Paradise

.   Traverse rightwards under the overhang, then move up on improving holds to finish.
